only able to be correctly understood when considered in connection with other words or ideas: These pronouns are intrinsically syncategorematic terms - their semantic value depends on the noun phrase to which they are linked. Words like prepositions, conjunctions, adverbs, are syncategorematic.
More examplesFewer examplesIn syncategorematic modification, interpretation of the adjective depends on the noun - most likely a "good shirt" is for special occasions, whilst a "good car" runs well. These texts set out the logical conditions for the use of syncategorematic words.This is a reworking of the earlier syncategorematic analysis.
